text: We made some big changes on Pluto#master that are not ready to be released yet, but we would like to release a patch update with a small change relative to our latest release. Is this possible?

elements.text: We made some big changes on Pluto#master that are not ready to be released yet, but we would like to release a patch update with a small change relative to our latest release. Is this possible?

text: like do it in a branch?

elements.text: like do it in a branch?

text: yeah i guess my question is: can I release from a branch? am i allowed to delete that branch later?

elements.text: yeah i guess my question is: can I release from a branch? am i allowed to delete that branch later?

text:
1) yes, no problem releasing from a branch
2) you are allowed as long as you're happy to make a version to disappear, which sounds like a very bad idea

elements.text:
1) yes, no problem releasing from a branch
2) you are allowed as long as you're happy to make a version to disappear, which sounds like a very bad idea

text: Deleting the branch after the release doesn't make the code inaccessible AFAIK

elements.text: Deleting the branch after the release doesn't make the code inaccessible AFAIK

text: in the sense that GitHub keeps everything forever under the hood?

elements.text: in the sense that GitHub keeps everything forever under the hood?

text: A Git tag will definitely preserve it

elements.text: A Git tag will definitely preserve it

text: but anyway, I wouldn't encourage testing GitHub persistence and avoid doing something bad

elements.text: but anyway, I wouldn't encourage testing GitHub persistence and avoid doing something bad

text: Great, I will keep it then, thank you!

elements.text: Great, I will keep it then, thank you!

text: Yeah you should create a corresponding tag

elements.text: Yeah you should create a corresponding tag

text: The branch doesn't matter after that

elements.text: The branch doesn't matter after that
